column1: Saint-Mandé (French: [sɛ̃.mɑ̃.de]) is a high-end commune of the Val-de-Marne department in Île-de-France in the eastern suburbs of Paris
column2: France. It is located 5.3 km (3.3 mi) from the center of Paris. It is one of the smallest communes of the Île-de-France by land area
column3: but is one of the most densely populated municipalities in Europe. It is located on the edge of the 12th arrondissement of Paris
column4: near the Porte de Vincennes and the Porte de Saint-Mandé.

column1: The motto of the city is Cresco et Floresco
column2: which means "I grow and I flourish".
the city of Paris was enlarged by annexing neighboring communes. On that occasion
column3: about two-thirds of the commune of Saint-Mandé was annexed to Paris
column4: and now forms the neighborhoods of Bel-Air and Picpus

column2: the commune of Saint-Mandé lost one-quarter of its territory when the city of Paris annexed the Bois de Vincennes
column3: a small part of which belonged to Saint-Mandé
column4: leaving Saint-Mandé as a small rump commune after the territorial losses of 1860 and 1929.

column1: The municipality is crossed by a principal north–south axis
column2: the Avenue du Général-de-Gaulle (formerly Rue de la République)
column4: the Avenue de Paris (RN 34). Another important and historical street of the municipality is the Chaussée de l'Étang which goes along the Bois de Vincennes.

column1: Saint-Mandé is served by Saint-Mandé station on Paris Métro Line 1
column2: as well as line no 8. RATP buses include lines 46

column1: The closest airport is Roissy Charles-de-Gaulle
